metadata.title_text:
Detailed instructions and information for VOC officers arriving in Batavia and the Cape,watermarked with an equestrian portrait of Willem IV, Prince of Orange Nassau
1748
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a handwritten manuscript, in Dutch containing detailed instructions and information for VOC officers arriving in Batavia and the Cape.
metadata.subject_terms_1: written word Dutch Colonial watermarks manuscripts (documents) stadtholders
metadata.subject_terms_2: administration Watermarks Orange-Nassau, House of Stadholders Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie Manuscripts Netherlands
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
The handwritten document illustrates at a very fundamental level the colonial practice of administration of the Dutch VOC. The manuscript in Dutch reveals various aspects including 
protocols, procedures, finances and administrative paperwork for VOC officers arriving in Batavia and the Cape of Good Hope. Among other instructions to be found is information on the cost of purchasing a black slave boy in Batavia and the expense of his upkeep.
